item.title: Simulation on controlling confounders
item.description: Confounder A confounder is on of the few (maybe three) “atoms” of causality, following the framework of Judea Parl and others. A confounder can be depicted like this: Following a study that reported a strong correlation between chocolate consumption and Nobel prices. Simulating a confounder structure Now let’s simulate a simple confounder structure. Here’s some code that will help us: Let’s have a look at the code: ## ## n <- 100 ## ## set.
